title: Fishers of men,
author: Crockett, S. R.
snippet: So they took a furnished house in Glencairn Crescent, well out beyond the cathedral, and helped or hindered Mr. Molesay according to their moods — which in the circumstances were naturally various and uncertain. They bought books for the library of the B. I. P. — Baby Lant attending

title: Fishers of men,
author: Crockett, S. R.
snippet: The night upon which William, the butler — afraid to remain in Egham Castle because of a few chairs, symmetrically placed, with clothes neatly folded upon them — remained in Glencairn Crescent was remarkable also for two other things.

title: Fishers of men,
author: Crockett, S. R.
snippet: It was a November evening, early dark, and the two girls, Pat and Baby Lant, found themselves cozily installed at the house in Glencairn Crescent, which the Eghamites and the Three Ridings people had found so convenient that they had retained it, paying the rent between them.
